info.description: This is a JSON API compliant implementation

tags.name: Content - Basic page

data.description: \"Resource objects\" appear in a JSON:API document to represent resources.

revision_timestamp.title: Revision create time
revision_timestamp.description: The time that the current revision was created.

revision_log.title: Revision log message
revision_log.description: Briefly describe the changes you have made.

created.title: Authored on
created.description: The time that the node was created.

changed.title: Changed
changed.description: The time that the node was last edited.

default_langcode.title: Default translation
default_langcode.description: A flag indicating whether this is the default translation.

revision_default.title: Default revision
revision_default.description: A flag indicating whether this was a default revision when it was saved.

revision_translation_affected.title: Revision translation affected
revision_translation_affected.description: Indicates if the last edit of a translation belongs to current revision.

additionalProperties.description: A link **MUST** be represented as either: a string containing the link's URL or a link object .

get.description: Collection endpoint for the node--page resource type. Collections are a list of resource objects for a particular resource type. In the JSON API module for Drupal all collections are homogeneous, which means that all the items in a collection are of the same type.

parameters.name: resourceVersion
parameters.description: The JSON:API module exposes entity revisions as resource versions. Learn more in the documentation.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The JSON:API module has some of the most robust and feature-rich filtering features around. All of that power comes with a bit of a learning curve though. Learn more in the documentation.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The JSON:API module allows you to sort collections based on properties in the resource or in nested resources. Learn more in the documentation.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Pagination can be a deceptively complex topic. It's easy to fall into traps and not follow best-practices. Learn more in the documentation.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Embed related entities in the response. For example: use a query string like ?include=comments.author to include all the entities referenced by comments and all the entities referenced by author on those entities!. Learn more in the documentation.

get.description: Collection endpoint for the paragraph--hero resource type. Collections are a list of resource objects for a particular resource type. In the JSON API module for Drupal all collections are homogeneous, which means that all the items in a collection are of the same type.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The JSON:API module has some of the most robust and feature-rich filtering features around. All of that power comes with a bit of a learning curve though. Learn more in the documentation.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The JSON:API module allows you to sort collections based on properties in the resource or in nested resources. Learn more in the documentation.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Pagination can be a deceptively complex topic. It's easy to fall into traps and not follow best-practices. Learn more in the documentation.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Embed related entities in the response. For example: use a query string like ?include=comments.author to include all the entities referenced by comments and all the entities referenced by author on those entities!. Learn more in the documentation.
